title: Ample parking space and alternative modes of transport make Modhesh World an easily accessible destination for familiesTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Ample parking space and alternative modes of transport make Modhesh World an easily accessible destination for families Published on : Thursday, August 20, 2015
Modhesh World, one of the largest indoor edutainment destinations in the region, offers its visitors a number of convenient options to access the venue, making it a hassle-free experience for all.
From ample parking facilities to its close proximity to Dubai Metro’s World Trade Centre station – visitors can either choose to drive to the destination themselves or ride the metro with families to experience Modhesh World’s world-class array of attractions, activities and stage shows.
Modhesh World’s central location at Dubai World Trade Centre (DWTC) – a landmark of Dubai and a popular venue for some of the biggest events and exhibitions hosted in Dubai – makes it an easily accessible destination for tourists and residents alike.
Those driving to the destination in their own cars can choose to park in the free-of-charge parking slots that can accommodate up to 3,000 cars at any given time or can alternatively park at one of the 2,000 dedicated DWTC spots that are available for use at minimal rates. From these parking spots, visitors are led directly to the entrance. Several security cameras are also in place to ensure the safety of the cars.
Those visitors who choose to park in the free parking lot can also access Modhesh World safely through a pedestrian bridge that connects the parking lot to the venue.
Further, guests also have a third parking option available to them at the rented parking area by Roads and Transport Authority (RTA) where drivers can pay for parking using their Nol Cards, at the parking ticket payment machines or through an SMS service on their mobiles.
In addition to all these parking options, Modhesh World offers valet parking services and there are also ample dedicated disabled-parking spots.
Modhesh World is organised by the Dubai Festivals and Retail Establishment (DFRE), an agency of the Department of Tourism and Commerce Marketing (DTCM). The 16th edition of Modhesh World, which kicked off on 9 July 2015 at the Dubai World Trade Centre and runs until 29 August under the theme- ‘Every step is a new adventure’, has many other features and facilities including exclusive souvenir shops showcasing Modhesh World memorabilia, an array of dining outlets featuring a variety of cuisines, in addition to two dedicated lounges for families to relax. Spacious parking spaces and affordable ticket prices together with world-class entertainment makes Modhesh World a great choice for kids and their families to enjoy the perfect summer holiday, right here in Dubai.
Modhesh World opens at 9am until midnight from Saturday to Wednesday and from 9am to 1am on Thursdays and Fridays. The entrance fee is AED 20 for kids and adults and entry is free for kids under 3 years of age.
